comments.body:
Prior to deleting the snapshot we should probably test that we can re-tag the snapshot.

The docs don't explicitly call it out, but if you pass a snapshot_id you can add tags to an existing snapshot.  (don't like that you can't remove them, but that's out of scope here)
I'm not seeing how this would work, ec2.create_snapshot does not take a snapshot_id. Can you provide a sample task?

Ah, sorry it was passing the volume_id that would let your do it rather than snapshot_id:

```
ec2_snapshot:
  state: present
  volume_id: 'vol-123456789abc'
  tags:
    some: thing

ec2_snapshot:
  state: present
  volume_id: 'vol-123456789abc'
  tags:
    my: Tag
  last_snapshot_min_age: 50000
```
Ah OK that works, but also doesn't correctly handle changed status.  I started to fix that and it quickly exploded so I'll PR that feature separately before coming back here. Thx.

comments.body:
While it's not documented (ec2_snapshot doesn't document any return values) ec2_snapshot looks like it also returns volume_id, volume_size and tags.

Since there's currently **no** return documentation I'm guessing people (like me) would simply look at the output of -vvv and rely on consistent output.   As such I guess we should test the other output values to ensure that when someone has chance to migrate from boto2 to boto3 they don't get dropped.
Now with bonus return docs! (It's maybe overloading this PR a bit, but it's a small enough addition.)
